flawed_nl_solution:
His smaller truck is 8000*0.3=<<8000*0.3=2400>>2400 gallons smaller
So it can transport 8000-2400=<<8000-2400=5600>>5600 gallons
There are 6-2-1=<<6-2-1=7>>7 of the very large trucks
Those trucks are each 8000*0.5=<<8000*0.5=4000>>4000 gallons larger
So they can transport 8000+4000=<<8000+4000=12000>>12000 gallons
So in total they transport 7*12000=<<7*12000=84000>>84000
The 8000-gallon trucks can transport 8000*2=<<8000*2=16000>>16000 gallons
So in total he can transport 5600+16000+84000=<<5600+16000+84000=105600>>105600 gallons
#### 105600

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 3, not 7. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
